concepts.label: Ego
concepts.definition: The center of conscious identity and agency; the standpoint of "I" in experience.

concepts.label: Shadow
concepts.definition: Disowned, rejected, or unconscious contents that appear indirectly through symptoms and projection.

concepts.label: Projection
concepts.definition: The displacement of unconscious contents onto people, groups, or events, distorting perception.

concepts.label: Syzygy
concepts.definition: A paired structure of opposites (often anima and animus) that mediates relation to the unconscious.

concepts.label: Anima
concepts.definition: The inner feminine figure in a man, shaping feeling-toned relation to the unconscious.

concepts.label: Animus
concepts.definition: The inner masculine figure in a woman, shaping judgment, meaning-making, and logos orientation.

concepts.label: Self
concepts.definition: The archetype of wholeness and psychic totality that orders life beyond the ego standpoint.

concepts.label: Individuation
concepts.definition: The developmental process of integrating conscious and unconscious contents toward greater wholeness.

concepts.label: Archetype
concepts.definition: A universal structural pattern of the psyche expressed through symbols, myths, and recurring motifs.

concepts.label: Coniunctio
concepts.definition: A symbolic union of opposites, central to alchemical imagery and to psychological integration work.

concepts.label: Opposites
concepts.definition: The tension of contrary psychic tendencies whose containment can generate transformation.

concepts.label: Christ as Self Symbol
concepts.definition: A psychological reading of Christ imagery as an archetypal representation of the Self and wholeness.

concepts.label: Antichrist Motif
concepts.definition: A symbolic counter-pole to the Christ image, expressing excluded shadow aspects within a totality frame.

concepts.label: Quaternity
concepts.definition: Fourfold symbolic structure that images a more complete wholeness than one-sided perfection.

concepts.label: Aeon
concepts.definition: A long historical-astrological age whose symbols shape collective imagination and conflict.

concepts.label: Fish Symbol
concepts.definition: A historically layered motif in Aion that carries paradoxical meanings of totality, salvation, and shadow.

concepts.label: Collective Unconscious
concepts.definition: A transpersonal layer of psyche expressed through archetypal patterns, symbols, and shared images.

concepts.label: Prophecy
concepts.definition: Collective meaning-making that can constellate around crisis, symbolism, and projection in historical time.

concepts.label: Alchemy
concepts.definition: A symbolic tradition whose images can be read as dramatizations of psychological transformation processes.

concepts.label: Prima Materia
concepts.definition: The "raw material" of transformation: undifferentiated, chaotic, or conflicted psychic content at the start of the opus.

concepts.label: Mercurius
concepts.definition: A duplex mediator archetype in alchemy: ambivalent spirit-matter principle linking opposites.

concepts.label: Lapis Philosophorum
concepts.definition: The philosopher's stone as an image of realized transformation and stabilized union of opposites.

concepts.label: Symbolic Interpretation
concepts.definition: A disciplined way of reading images psychologically without reducing them to literal history or private fantasy.

concepts.label: Gnosticism
concepts.definition: A symbolic-religious current whose images of knowledge and paradox can be read as approaches to psychic totality.
